nodes.bodyText: Double check: Does this work on Windows and Linux equally well? Mayybe OS.NEW_LINE should be used?
The alternative implementation could have been to update the regular expression. I am really not sure why it stopped working.

Interestingly enough when using OS.NEW_LINE on Windows its breaks.
need to do an test on linux though, currently having problems running my vm.
Maybe it should check both? We don't know which line endings the user has in the template files (if modified)
This is not the date format shown in #6974 (comment), is it?

no that is not the shown date format, Pandoc accepts a number of different formats for dates.
Using pandoc to convert a .bib file to .yaml also outputs yyyy-mm-dd.
Is it possible to add the test bib from #6974 or is that difficult?
adding the exact yaml file as a test case ist not difficult, but i dont think it ist necessary as pandoc also uses yyyy-mm-dd as a default. I did a a testcase that uses all those fields.
